summary: The Special Interest Alien Reporting Act of 2024 (H.R. 275) directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to publish a public report by the seventh day of each month. This report must detail the total number of "special interest aliens" encountered attempting to unlawfully enter the U.S. during the preceding month. A "special interest alien" is defined as an individual who may pose a national security risk based on travel patterns. The report must include their nationalities, the geographic region of the encounter, and whether the encounter occurred at or between official ports of entry.
